channel.title: Portforwarding Netgear Router Help Me Please!
channel.description: [i][font=Teen]I have [s][u][b]ALOT[/b][/u][/s] of friends that can portforward there routers for them to host. But everyone is telling me its impossible fore a Netgear router to be able to host and have your server [/i]Online[i]. If you have a Netgear router or know how to portforward one. Please reply or message me on my Msn at: DarkAngelScape@Live.Com. Thank you for reading, and I hope to hear from you. :D

I’ll try again when I go home.

item.title: Portforwarding Netgear Router Help Me Please!
item.dc:creator: @bob_2 bob 2
item.description:
@bob_2 wrote:

do these exact steps to get your server running:

  1. download utorrent, www.utorrent.com
  2. close anything server related.
  3. open up utorrent, go to options, preferences, connection, then change the port to 43594 or whatever port you plan to use
  4. make sure other torrent programs are closed (limewire , bittorrent,etc.)
  5. open up no-ip
  6. run server
  7. open up utorrent, make sure your preferences were saved

It should now be online, enjoy.

Read full topic
item.source: Portforwarding Netgear Router Help Me Please!
